meaningMnemonic: A <kanji>luggage</kanji> <kanji>thing</kanji> is your <vocabulary>luggage</vocabulary>. It's also your <vocabulary>baggage</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>load</vocabulary> too.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. You'll need to remember the 物 reading as もつ, though. Why? Because all your luggage just got thrown into various <reading>moats</reading> along the countryside. It's going to take you forever to collect your luggage from these moats and by then it'll be all soggy. Dangit...
